content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Extraction System at Position(-3.5, 27.5)
Use-case: Serves as the material‐extraction output point.
• Consists of a burner inserter at (–3.5, 27.5) with drop position (–3.5, 28.5).

### Copper Cable Factory at Interface (Chest at 2.5,17.5)
Use-case: Converts copper plates into copper cables.
• Consists of a cable factory input chest at (2.5, 17.5).
• A factory burner inserter placed at (3.5, 17.5) (using direction RIGHT).
• An assembling machine at (1.5, 19.5) configured for copper‐cable production.

### Belt Depot System at Depot (Primary Chest at 3.5,15.5)
Use-case: Provides an isolated belt target for routing extraction outputs.
• Consists of a wooden chest at (3.5, 15.5) serving as the depot.
• An adjacent transport belt segment at (4.5, 15.5).
• A dedicated depot burner inserter at (3.5, 14.5) (using direction UP).

### Electricity Generator at Position(–0.5, 24.5)
Use-case: Supplies power to the network.
• Consists of a steam engine (“Generator”) at (–0.5, 24.5).
• A boiler at (–5.5, 24.0).
• An offshore pump at (–7.5, 25.5).

### Research Lab 
Use-case: Hosts research operations (science pack input); created with electrical integration (electrical_id=7106).
• Consists of a laboratory entity (electrical_id=7106) with no explicit position provided.

ERROR TIPS
────────────
• Errors when connecting transport belts to targets  
 – Transport belts were repeatedly attempted to be connected directly to a steam engine.  
  • Tip: Always ensure the target for belt connection is a suitable inserter (or similar valid input entity) rather than a steam engine.

• Errors during entity placement due to distance  
 – An error occurred when trying to place a wooden chest at (3.5,15.5) from a distant player position.  
  • Tip: Move closer to the target position so that the distance is within the allowed placement range.

• Inventory shortages on placement  
 – An attempt to place a wooden chest after moving failed because none was available in the inventory.  
  • Tip: Verify that the required item (e.g. wooden-chest) exists in the inventory before placement.

• Variable naming errors  
 – A NameError (“target_chest is not defined”) arose during the belt connection process.  
  • Tip: Ensure variables are correctly defined and referenced (using names such as target_pos, target_place_pos, or depot_chest as appropriate).
